competitors.name: Microsoft Power BI
competitors.notes: Cloud-based analytics platform integrated with Microsoft ecosystem, became major competitor after 2011 launch

competitors.name: Tableau
competitors.notes: Leading data visualization tool with interactive dashboards and reports, acquired by Salesforce in 2019

competitors.name: Looker
competitors.notes: Cloud-based BI platform acquired by Google Cloud in 2019, known for LookML modeling language

competitors.name: Qlik Sense
competitors.notes: Self-service data visualization and discovery application, evolution of QlikView

competitors.name: Sisense
competitors.notes: BI platform for complex data analytics, competitor in cloud BI space

competitors.name: MicroStrategy
competitors.notes: Enterprise BI platform with interactive dashboards and advanced analytics capabilities

competitors.name: Amazon QuickSight
competitors.notes: AWS cloud-based BI service for visualizations and ad-hoc analysis, launched 2016

competitors.name: IBM Cognos Analytics
competitors.notes: Enterprise BI platform with reporting and dashboarding features

competitors.name: Zoho Analytics
competitors.notes: Self-service BI and data analytics software with data visualizations and dashboards

competitors.name: Alteryx
competitors.notes: Data analytics platform noted as strong overall alternative to Domo

context: By 2020, the cloud BI market had matured significantly. Major tech companies had acquired key players (Salesforce-Tableau 2019, Google-Looker 2019). Microsoft Power BI had become a dominant force with its affordable pricing and Microsoft ecosystem integration. The competitive landscape was characterized by cloud-native solutions, self-service analytics, and integration capabilities. Domo competed in a crowded market against both established enterprise vendors and newer cloud-first platforms.
